tagline: documentation for porting linux on Aakash
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
name: Linux-on-aakash
body:
![Aakash logo](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-z0r2Q9_tPnY/UMmhqLzNjNI/AAAAAAAABeU/vIP_4zMur4o/s773/aakash-logo.png)
 
[Aakash] (http://www.it.iitb.ac.in/aakash2/index.jsp) is a low cost computing device/tablet for students, the project is initiated and funded by MHRD, Govt. of India. Aakash already runs Android 4.0 with many educational apps made by IIT Bombay. Please refer to [androportal](http://github.com/androportal) for some of the apps. 

This is the landing page for the **Linux on Aakash** documentation. 
To report any bugs please raise [issues](https://github.com/androportal/linux-on-aakash/issues). 


## Contents

  1. [Setting up the hardware] (https://github.com/androportal/linux-on-aakash/wiki/Setting-up-the-hardware)
  2. [Setting up software tool chain] (https://github.com/androportal/linux-on-aakash/wiki/Setting-up-software-tool-chain)
  3. [Compiling uboot] (https://github.com/androportal/linux-on-aakash/wiki/Compiling-uboot)
  4. [Compiling kernel] (https://github.com/androportal/linux-on-aakash/wiki/Compiling-kernel)
  5. [Getting filesystem ready] (https://github.com/androportal/linux-on-aakash/wiki/Getting-filesystem-ready)
  6. [Tablet tweaks] (https://github.com/androportal/linux-on-aakash/wiki/Tablet-tweaks)
  7. [Known issues(must read)] (https://github.com/androportal/linux-on-aakash/wiki/Known-issues)
  8. [FAQs] (https://github.com/androportal/linux-on-aakash/wiki/FAQs)
  9. [TODO] (https://github.com/androportal/linux-on-aakash/wiki/TODO)
  10. [References] (https://github.com/androportal/linux-on-aakash/wiki/References)
